data.Title: Google Search Updates
data.Description: Google Search is experiencing a wave of updates, including new sitelink designs, AI-powered overviews for health queries, and credit card carousels. The search giant has also clarified its stance on 404 errors and updated its sitemap documentation to emphasize accurate "lastmod" values.

data.Title: Google's AI Advancements
data.Description: Google is heavily investing in AI across its products and services. Gmail is introducing a Gemini-powered "Summarize this email" button, while Google is reportedly developing a product for creating customizable chatbots, potentially modeled after celebrities.

data.Title: Google Local Service Ads
data.Description: Google is introducing automated lead crediting for Local Service Ads, a move that has sparked debate among advertisers. Additionally, Google is leveraging AI to write business descriptions for local listings, raising concerns about accuracy and control.

data.Title: Google's Privacy Sandbox and Post-Cookie Planning
data.Description: Despite Google's delay in deprecating third-party cookies, marketers are urged to continue their post-cookie planning. The Private Aggregation API, part of Google's Privacy Sandbox, offers a means for marketers to receive reach and frequency reports in a privacy-conscious manner.

data.Title: AI in Ecommerce
data.Description: Shopify has unveiled AI-focused updates for merchants, including suggested replies, product categorization, and the early access launch of its AI chatbot, Sidekick. However, there are concerns about the accuracy and potential for misuse of these AI tools.

data.Title: Google's Legal Battles
data.Description: Google executives Sundar Pichai and Sergey Brin are facing questioning in a digital ads lawsuit. This comes amidst a wave of AI-related lawsuits, including the RIAA's case against AI music services Suno and Udio for alleged copyright infringement.

data.Title: Structured Data Updates
data.Description: Google has added new guidance for structured data carousels, specifically on how to mark up categories with multiple items. The company has also discussed issues related to using JavaScript for structured data with Google Merchant Center.
